title: Glaive of Prune
data:
***Version [0.30](/0.30 "0.30")**: This article **may not be** up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of Crawl.*

|   |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
| - | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | The glaive of Prune carries a terrible and insidious curse. Unless its wielder maintains firm self-control, they are doomed to succumb, undergoing a horrifying (albeit temporary) transformation. This is normally trivial to resist, but incapacitated wielders are certain to succumb, finding themselves nightmarishly purple, squishy, and delicious. They can take comfort in learning that it's surprisingly hard to injure a giant prune. |

[![Glaive of prune.png](/images/9/98/Glaive_of_prune.png)](/File:Glaive_of_prune.png) ***the glaive of Prune***

+12 [glaive](/Glaive "Glaive")

[Freezing](/Freezing "Freezing") brand  
[Transforms](/Transformation "Transformation") the user into a prune if they are [paralysed](/Paralysed "Paralysed"), [petrified](/Petrified "Petrified"), or [asleep](/Asleep "Asleep"), halving damage taken  
[Chaotic](/Chaotic "Chaotic")

## Desirability

In most situations, the **glaive of Prune**[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) is just a +12 freezing glaive. It's around the level of a +9 [bardiche](/Bardiche "Bardiche") of freezing (slightly weaker), but takes less skill to wield effectively. Characters who use two-handed [Polearms](/Polearms "Polearms") will find it a good weapon.

In addition, the prune "curse" reduces damage when afflicted with some of the most dangerous status conditions in the game. It takes a large amount of [willpower](/Willpower "Willpower") to completely resist enemy [Hexes](/Hexes "Hexes"), so this glaive is quite useful as another safeguard. There are also [some](/Hornet "Hornet") [partially](/Air_elemental "Air elemental") [irresistible](/Floating_eye "Floating eye") [ways](/Sleepcap "Sleepcap") to be paralyzed or [put to sleep](/Dream_Dust "Dream Dust"), assuming you aren't a [Formicid](/Formicid "Formicid") with [clarity](/Clarity "Clarity"). (Certain methods listed are stopped by other species-specific resistances, but are not available to most players).

As it is a transformative artifact, followers of [Zin](/Zin "Zin") will incur [penance](/Penance "Penance") when using the glaive of Prune.

The prune curse will also activate if and when you die, but at that point, there's no saving you.

## History

- Prior to [0.30](/0.30 "0.30"), the Glaive of Prune had the [vorpal](/Vorpal "Vorpal") brand instead of [freezing](/Freezing "Freezing").
- Prior to [0.28](/0.28 "0.28"), the prune curse had no in-game effect.
- Prior to [0.15](/0.15 "0.15"), the glaive of Prune had a +4,+12 enchantment.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [art-data.txt:228](https://github.com/crawl/crawl/blob/0.30.0/crawl-ref/source/art-data.txt#L228) (0.30.0)
html:
Glaive of Prune

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.30: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.
The glaive of Prune carries a terrible and insidious curse. Unless its wielder maintains firm self-control, they are doomed to succumb, undergoing a horrifying (albeit temporary) transformation. This is normally trivial to resist, but incapacitated wielders are certain to succumb, finding themselves nightmarishly purple, squishy, and delicious. They can take comfort in learning that it's surprisingly hard to injure a giant prune.

the glaive of Prune

+12 glaive

Freezing brand
Transforms the user into a prune if they are paralysed, petrified, or asleep, halving damage taken
Chaotic

Desirability

In most situations, the glaive of Prune[1] is just a +12 freezing glaive. It's around the level of a +9 bardiche of freezing (slightly weaker), but takes less skill to wield effectively. Characters who use two-handed Polearms will find it a good weapon.

In addition, the prune "curse" reduces damage when afflicted with some of the most dangerous status conditions in the game. It takes a large amount of willpower to completely resist enemy Hexes, so this glaive is quite useful as another safeguard. There are also some partially irresistible ways to be paralyzed or put to sleep, assuming you aren't a Formicid with clarity. (Certain methods listed are stopped by other species-specific resistances, but are not available to most players).

As it is a transformative artifact, followers of Zin will incur penance when using the glaive of Prune.

The prune curse will also activate if and when you die, but at that point, there's no saving you.

History

  • Prior to 0.30, the Glaive of Prune had the vorpal brand instead of freezing.
  • Prior to 0.28, the prune curse had no in-game effect.
  • Prior to 0.15, the glaive of Prune had a +4,+12 enchantment.

References

  1. ↑ art-data.txt:228 (0.30.0)
Retrieved from "http://crawl.chaosforge.org/index.php?title=Glaive_of_Prune&oldid=70553"
